content.rendered:
Kick off the night with the electrifying sounds of Trans-Siberian Orchestra, then stick around for Laser Musicals featuring hits from Wicked, Dear Evan Hansen, Dreamgirls, Les Misérables, and more. A perfect winter night out with epic music and full-dome laser magic.

Showtimes

  • 7:30 p.m.: Laser Trans-Siberian Orchestra
  • 9 p.m.: Laser: The Musical

Know Before You Go

  • Laser nights are recommended for teens and adults.
  • Seating is first come, first served. Bring a pillow and blanket if you want to lay on the floor!
  • Food and drink from concessions are welcome inside the Laser Dome.
  • Shows can sell out, advance tickets strongly recommended.

excerpt.rendered: Enjoy a December 17 double feature with Laser Trans-Siberian Orchestra and a Broadway-packed Laser Musicals show.

content.rendered:
This December, our Laser Artists take over the Dome. Each night features their personal favorites. They hand-picked laser shows they love creating most. From GRiZ to Queen to Rosalia and SZA, expect bold visuals, immersive sound, and an option for everyone!

Artists & Schedule

Neo: Monday, December 22

  • 7:30 p.m.: Laser GRiZ
  • 9 p.m.: Laser TOOL

Ursa: Tuesday, December 23

  • 7:30 p.m.: Laser ABBA
  • 9 p.m.: Laser Queen

Zimona: Monday, December 29

  • 7:30 p.m.: Laser Odesza
  • 9 p.m.: Laser Lorde

Scotty: Tuesday, December 30

  • 7:30 p.m.: Laser Rosalía
  • 9 p.m.: Laser SZA

title.rendered: Nova—New Year’s Eve at Pacific Science Center

content.rendered:
New Beginnings Under the Arches

Ring in the new year at Nova, an after hours takeover of Pacific Science Center! This space-meets-disco New Year’s bash will be out of this world—so channel your inner cosmic glam in fits that would wow Daft Punk, Captain Kirk, or David Bowie. At midnight, we’ll gather in the courtyard for a front-row view of the best fireworks in the city and toast to a stellar 2026! 

What to Expect

  • Live aerialist performances, silent disco, and a Laser Dome dance party with DJ Kween Kaysh 
  • Tarot card readings and a Resolution Wall to tap into the energy of the cosmos 
  • Light art installations by artists like Fox Light Labs, Seattle Design Nerds, and more to be announced 
  • DIY craft stations, a photo booth, and single/taken wristbands to help guests mingle 
  • A specialty menu with food catered by Gourmondo plus an assortment of beer, wine, champagne, cider, and themed cocktails 
  • And a 2026 countdown featuring an incredible view of Seattle Center’s fireworks show! 

Tickets

Each ticket includes food, two drink tokens, all nonalcoholic drinks, and a gift bag with a commemorative champagne flute. All proceeds directly benefit Pacific Science Center’s nonprofit mission to expand access to STEM education across the region. 

  • Igniters* & Members: $125
  • Non-Members: $140

*If you are part of our Igniter Donor Society, your ticket includes exclusive access to our Igniter Champagne Lounge. This VIP area will have more food and complimentary champagne throughout the evening. Not an Igniter yet? Learn more about the impact our donor society makes each year.

excerpt.rendered: Celebrate New Year’s Eve at Pacific Science Center’s Nova, a 21+ cosmic-inspired party.

content.rendered:
Sensory-Friendly Hours at Pacific Science Center are designed for learners of all ages with sensory sensitivities who benefit from a calmer and more accessible environment.

Formerly known as Exploration for All, these special events feature adjusted lighting and sound to ensure a welcoming and engaging experience for all attendees.

What to Expect

  • Softened lighting and reduced noise levels throughout the space.
  • Adjusted hands-on activities and exhibits tailored for a sensory-friendly experience.
  • Access to the Sensory Lounge, a quiet retreat available during all visits to PacSci.
  • A free social narrative is available online year-round to help guests plan their visit.

Tickets

  • Member Tickets
  • Non-Member Tickets
  • Walk-up tickets are also available at Main Entry at the event.

Contact us with any question or need more information. Learn more about Accessibility at PacSci.

Generous Support Provided By:

Additional support comes from more than 2,500 individuals, companies, and foundations that donate to the Science Center each year. Learn more about ways you can support the Access to Science Pipeline and Pacific Science Center.
